CreditLine: Acquired by William T. Walters, before 1889
Description: In this tender scene, one lion cub rests his head against the haunches of the other.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Untamed: The Art of Antoine-Louis Barye
Exhibitions.Textblock: Untamed: The Art of Antoine-Louis Barye. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; Philbrook Museum of Art, Tulsa; The Henry Morrison Flagler Museum, Palm Beach. 2007-2008.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore; Birmingham Museum of Art, Birmingham; Tacoma Art Museum, Tacoma. 2005-2006.
The Works of Antoine-Louis Barye. American Art Gallery (New York), New York. 1889-1890.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: A Supple Brush: The Flowering of Continental Watercolors
Exhibitions.Textblock: A Supple Brush: The Flowering of Continental Watercolors. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1979.

Inscriptions: [Signature] Painted in black watercolor at center lower edge on recto: BARYE;  [Number] Written in graphite, lower left on verso: 19
Medium: watercolor with gum heightening on rough, thick, cream wove paper
Provenance: William T. Walters, Baltimore, prior to 1889 [mode of acquisition unknown];  Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1894, by inheritance;  Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Two Lion Cubs
